job_title: Storage Engineer (SME) - Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency (DPAA) - Crystal City Arlington, VA (TS/SCI Required)
job_text: ['', 'Scheduled Weekly Hours', 'Travel Required', 'Experience with Windows Server 2012/2016.', 'VMware Certified Professional and AWS Certification is a plus.', 'Technical Skills - Assesses own strengths and weaknesses; Pursues training and development opportunities; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others.', 'Job Duties Include', 'Responsible for storage on NIPR/SIPR/JWICS networks; NetApp storage management of CIFS shares & LUNs; NetApp snapshot & snapmirror management; NetApp software support to include Data ONTAP updates/upgrades; NetApp hardware support, to include hardware refresh, new disk shelf installation/configuration and network configurations. ', 'Education And Experience', 'Backup Administrator supporting critical VM and CIFS backup and recovery services on-site and in remote locations, world-wide. Services may include backup to disk and tape technologies.', 'Customer Service', 'Skills/Qualifications:', 'Analytical', 'Experience with design and development of high availability NetApp storage.', 'Technical Skills', 'Responsible for system security hardening per DoD Security and Technical Implementation Guidelines and providing required security documentation. ', 'Provides tier three technical support and troubleshooting assistance.Serves as Storage Administrator in support of NetApp Storage Area Network. Lead implementation, design, development and maintenance of NetApp filers in a VMware datacenter.Responsible for storage on NIPR/SIPR/JWICS networks; NetApp storage management of CIFS shares & LUNs; NetApp snapshot & snapmirror management; NetApp software support to include Data ONTAP updates/upgrades; NetApp hardware support, to include hardware refresh, new disk shelf installation/configuration and network configurations. Engineer and maintain COOP site for CIFS and as a data management platform integrated with VMware.Backup Administrator supporting critical VM and CIFS backup and recovery services on-site and in remote locations, world-wide. Services may include backup to disk and tape technologies.VMware vSphere management, including provisioning VM clones and templates, creation of VMFS datastores, and physical server consolidation. Responsible for building, optimizing, and management of Windows 2012/2016 servers in a VMware and AWS GovCloud environment. Develop and maintain system/application documentation, to include Standard Operating Procedures. Responsible for system security hardening per DoD Security and Technical Implementation Guidelines and providing required security documentation. Supports IAVA patching requirements for servers and systems under management.Interfaces with multiple levels of users to include VIPs, Management, and end users.Assists with daily on administration and maintenance activities.', 'Job Description', 'NetApp Certified Data Administrator (NCDA) certification required. ', 'Customer Service - Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Responds promptly to customer needs; Solicits customer feedback to improve service; Responds to requests for service and assistance; Meets commitments.', 'Responsible for building, optimizing, and management of Windows 2012/2016 servers in a VMware and AWS GovCloud environment. ', "Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.Customer Service - Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Responds promptly to customer needs; Solicits customer feedback to improve service; Responds to requests for service and assistance; Meets commitments.Technical Skills - Assesses own strengths and weaknesses; Pursues training and development opportunities; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others.Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data; Designs work flows and procedures.", 'Experience with NetApp (7-mode and Cluster mode), and VMware.Experience with Windows Server 2012/2016.Experience with AWS GovCloud and backup technology a plus.', 'Serves as Storage Administrator in support of NetApp Storage Area Network. this includes providing basic NetApp management and/or maintenance hands-on training to team members.Self-Motivated and Self-Monitoring, Exceptional Oral and Written Communications, Technical Communication, Problem Solving, and ability for Multi-tasking.', 'Must excel at system documentation, to include in-depth system configuration, topology and development of standard operating procedures.', 'Experience with Backup Technology is desired but not required.', 'In-depth performance monitoring and maintaining of storage system(s).', 'Competencies', 'Self-Motivated and Self-Monitoring, Exceptional Oral and Written Communications, Technical Communication, Problem Solving, and ability for Multi-tasking.', 'Other Skills/Qualifications', 'Interfaces with multiple levels of users to include VIPs, Management, and end users.', 'Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; job_text: ['', '5 to 7 years of experience in designing, developing, and maintaining highly available, supportable solutions. ', 'Excellent English communication skills, speaking and writing.', 'Work closely with the business and the product owner to build and deliver. ', '3 to 5 years of proven and relevant technical leadership in mobile and SaaS environments. ', 'Provide technical leadership while writing code majority of the time. job_title: Principal Software Engineer - Aviation Network Technology
job_text: ['', 'Prioritize and define what standards Skyward & Verizon should develop, which we should monitor, and which we should actively counter, working with all stakeholders.', 'Make clear decisions that promote well-defined, timely Verizon/Skyward capabilities and communicate our positions to concerned stakeholders.', 'Effectively communicate your knowledge of standards, product requirements, and needs to stakeholders in everyday verbal and written communication.', 'Lead, plan, design, develop, guide, improve the system design and architecture across cloud services, devices, networks, and partners to enable cellular aviation products.', '10 or more years of relevant work experience.', 'Outstanding attention to detail and organizational skills.', 'Ability to navigate ambiguity and drive balance between experimentation and productization requirements in a dynamic environment. Previous startup environment experience is a plus.', '6 or more years of relevant work experience.', 'Experience in machine learning, video processing and analysis, live data streaming, or geospatial technologies.', 'Lead, plan, design, develop, guide, improve the system design and architecture across cloud services, devices, networks, and partners to enable cellular aviation products.Work with diverse teams to deliver product increments in an agile fashion.Become a connected aviation subject matter expert, understanding embedded systems and the architecture, opportunities, and challenges of cellular network technologies.Make clear decisions that promote well-defined, timely Verizon/Skyward capabilities and communicate our positions to concerned stakeholders.Prioritize and define what standards Skyward & Verizon should develop, which we should monitor, and which we should actively counter, working with all stakeholders.Work to incorporate standards into products and services across teams and partners.Effectively communicate your knowledge of standards, product requirements, and needs to stakeholders in everyday verbal and written communication.', 'Experience with security and reliability over variable connections.', 'Work with diverse teams to deliver product increments in an agile fashion.', 'Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Aviation, or similar technical discipline, or 6 additional years of experience.', 'Experience and a passion for working with and improving Agile processes.', "You'll Need To Have", 'Experience in leading system software design and architecture incorporating cloud microservices that interact with at least one of the following: network or cellular connectivity, device applications, or embedded software.', 'Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Aviation, or similar technical discipline, or 6 additional years of experience.10 or more years of relevant work experience.Strong ability to define alternatives and make appropriate recommendations and strategies for the software ecosystem.Experience in the connected vehicle, aviation, or telecommunications industries.Experience in machine learning, video processing and analysis, live data streaming, or geospatial technologies.Experience with security and reliability over variable connections.Ability to navigate ambiguity and drive balance between experimentation and productization requirements in a dynamic environment. Previous startup environment experience is a plus.Experience with FAA-regulated aviation products, such as avionics systems.Clear written and oral communication skills.Experience and a passion for working with and improving Agile processes.Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work with and motivate team members, peers, and leadership.Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.Outstanding attention to detail and organizational skills.', 'When you join Verizon', 'Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.', 'Responsibilities', 'Even Better If You Have', 'Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work with and motivate team members, peers, and leadership.', 'Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Aviation, or similar technical discipline, or 4 additional years of experience.', 'Work to incorporate standards into products and services across teams and partners.', 'Become a connected aviation subject matter expert, understanding embedded systems and the architecture, opportunities, and challenges of cellular network technologies.', 'Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Aviation, or similar technical discipline, or 4 additional years of experience.6 or more years of relevant work experience.Experience in leading system software design and architecture incorporating cloud microservices that interact with at least one of the following: network or cellular connectivity, device applications, or embedded software.Experience working with and contributing to standards.', 'Diversity and Inclusion at Verizon', 'What You’ll Be Doing...', 'diversity and inclusion', 'Experience with FAA-regulated aviation products, such as avionics systems.', 'Experience in the connected vehicle, aviation, or telecommunications industries.', 'What we’re looking for...', 'Clear written and oral communication skills.', 'Strong ability to define alternatives and make appropriate recommendations and strategies for the software ecosystem.', 'Experience working with and contributing to standards.', 'As a Principal Software Engineer, you will play a vital role in aligning Skyward’s and Verizon’s efforts both in the development of technology as well as the standards that enable the acceleration of cellular connected aviation. In this role, you will participate in design and development of the system architecture, collaborate with internal and external partners, and develop and contribute to Verizon’s aviation interests in applicable aviation and telecommunication standards. You’ll work with our strategy and Aviation Development Center teams to develop inputs to standards and translate standards into input to product designs. The role will be part of a cross-discipline team focused on enabling 4G LTE and 5G connectivity in the drone and urban air mobility industries.', 'Equal Employment Opportunity', 'We’re looking for a Principal Software Engineer to join our Aviation Network Technology team. You’ll be working in an exciting startup environment within the foundation of a large company, Verizon. You will have the freedom and autonomy to do your best work, with the support and camaraderie you need to enjoy your job. In this role you will be contributing to the future of connected aviation within Verizon’s New Business Incubation team.']

['', 'About HCL', 'Skills Required', 'Jd', 'Candidate must be authorized to work in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor work visas at this time.About HCLHCL Technologies (HCL) empowers global enterprises with technology for the next decade today. HCL’s Mode 1-2-3 strategy, through its deep-domain industry expertise, customer-centricity and entrepreneurial culture of ideapreneurship™ enables businesses to transform into next-gen enterprises. HCL offers its services and products through three lines of business - IT and Business Services (ITBS), Engineering and R&D Services (ERS), and Products & Platforms (P&P). ITBS enables global enterprises to transform their businesses through offerings in areas of Applications, Infrastructure, Digital Process Operations, and next generation digital transformation solutions. ERS offers engineering services and solutions in all aspects of product development and platform engineering while under P&P. As a leading global technology company, HCL takes pride in its diversity, social responsibility, sustainability, and education initiatives. ['', 'Functions As a Data Analyst As Required.', 'Division', 'Req Number', 'Required Qualifications', 'EEO Statement', 'Company Description', 'Address Line 1', 'State', 'Job Category', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Location', 'About Performance Food Group CompanyBuilt on the many proud histories of our family of companies, Performance Food Group is a customer-centric foodservice distribution leader headquartered in Richmond, Virginia. Grounded by roots that date back to a grocery peddler in 1885, PFG today has a nationwide network of approximately 100 distribution centers, 22,000-plus talented associates and more than 5,000 valued suppliers across the country. With the goal of helping our customers thrive, we market and deliver quality food and related products to over 150,000 locations including independent and chain restaurants, schools, business and industry locations, healthcare facilities, vending distributors, office coffee service distributors, big box retailers and theaters. Building strong relationships is core to PFG’s success – from connecting associates with great career opportunities to connecting valued suppliers and quality products with PFG’s broad and diverse customer base. To learn more about PFG and our divisions, Performance Foodservice, PFG Customized and Vistar, visit pfgc.com.', 'Job Description']

job_title: Data Center Facility Operations Regional Startup Engineer
job_text: ['', 'Influence cross-functional partner involvement at both the tactical and strategic level.', 'Process oriented with high attention to detail.', 'Develop and maintain key programs supporting the overall Site Startup effort.', 'Support hiring and onboarding of Facility Operations personnel. Coordinate manufactured equipment testing participation and personally support when needed.', 'Serve as a technical/consultative resource concerning operations of Data Center facilities and equipment, specifically for sites in the construction phase.', 'Analytical, and communications experience with proven experience communicating details throughout all organizational levels.', 'Formal project management training and experience.', 'Highly skilled in use of Microsoft Office Suite and familiar with collaboration software. Experience in MS SharePoint, project management software (e.g. MS Project, P6, etc.), construction management tools, and data visualization software and tools.', 'Preferred Qualifications', "Bachelor's degree in an engineering or technical discipline (mechanical, electrical, or controls), or 10+ years of experience in one of these disciplines.Experience in working with processes.8+ years experience with construction and/or operations of mission critical facilities.Experience leading teams and sub-contractors.Experience educating and influencing cross-functional teams.Experience communicating risk versus benefit.Experience in integrated change management across a global organization.Experience with standard Data Center equipment to include: electrical distribution equipment from switchgear down to panelboards, VFDs, low voltage power and molded case circuit breakers, overhead IT busway, Diesel Generators, DX units, air handling units, water treatment equipment, controls and monitoring, and hot aisle containment accessories.Analytical, and communications experience with proven experience communicating details throughout all organizational levels.", '8+ years experience with construction and/or operations of mission critical facilities.', "Bachelor's degree in an engineering or technical discipline (mechanical, electrical, or controls), or 10+ years of experience in one of these disciplines.", 'Experience with standard Data Center equipment to include: electrical distribution equipment from switchgear down to panelboards, VFDs, low voltage power and molded case circuit breakers, overhead IT busway, Diesel Generators, DX units, air handling units, water treatment equipment, controls and monitoring, and hot aisle containment accessories.', 'Interface and coordinate with internal organizations and stakeholders to include Data Center Design, Infrastructure Construction Management, Global Facility Operations Support, Data Center Facilities Engineering Team, Procurement, and Logistics teams to support driving day one readiness.', 'Minimum Qualifications', 'Coordinate with the site teams to establish all required service contracts prior to handover.', 'Ability to travel domestically and internationally as needed (25%-50%).', 'Experience educating and influencing cross-functional teams.', 'Responsible for the Facility Operations Site Startup project plans for an assigned geographical region. To work closely with those site Facility Operations teams to support meeting all project milestones during construction.', 'Experience in working with processes.', 'Formal project management training and experience.Highly skilled in use of Microsoft Office Suite and familiar with collaboration software. Experience in MS SharePoint, project management software (e.g. MS Project, P6, etc.), construction management tools, and data visualization software and tools.Process oriented with high attention to detail.', 'Develop and approve processes, procedures, and reporting metrics that help drive successful turnover of new Data Centers.', 'Responsible for the Facility Operations Site Startup project plans for an assigned geographical region. To work closely with those site Facility Operations teams to support meeting all project milestones during construction.Develop and maintain key programs supporting the overall Site Startup effort.Identify and correct gaps in existing processes or lack thereof related to starting up new Data Center facilities.Influence cross-functional partner involvement at both the tactical and strategic level.Serve as a technical/consultative resource concerning operations of Data Center facilities and equipment, specifically for sites in the construction phase.Support hiring and onboarding of Facility Operations personnel. Coordinate manufactured equipment testing participation and personally support when needed.Ensure the General Contractor coordinates vendor training for technical and shift operations personnel.Coordinate with the site teams to establish all required service contracts prior to handover.Develop and approve processes, procedures, and reporting metrics that help drive successful turnover of new Data Centers.Coordinate with the site Facility Operations teams to facilitate execution of the Construction/Facility Operations handover checklist. Verify all deficiencies are documented with temporary mitigations plans in place, and a roadmap exists outlining implementation of final corrective actions and closeout.Interface and coordinate with internal organizations and stakeholders to include Data Center Design, Infrastructure Construction Management, Global Facility Operations Support, Data Center Facilities Engineering Team, Procurement, and Logistics teams to support driving day one readiness.Ability to travel domestically and internationally as needed (25%-50%).', 'Coordinate with the site Facility Operations teams to facilitate execution of the Construction/Facility Operations handover checklist. Verify all deficiencies are documented with temporary mitigations plans in place, and a roadmap exists outlining implementation of final corrective actions and closeout.', 'Experience communicating risk versus benefit.', 'Experience in integrated change management across a global organization.', 'Identify and correct gaps in existing processes or lack thereof related to starting up new Data Center facilities.', 'Ensure the General Contractor coordinates vendor training for technical and shift operations personnel.', 'Experience leading teams and sub-contractors.']

['', 'Mentor junior team members on technologies, process and leadership.', 'Customer DR Test Support', 'Experience with network security, networking technologies and with system, security, and network monitoring tools.', 'Perform requirements gathering for Network solution.', 'Diagnose, troubleshoot and resolve escalated issues.', 'Design, deploy and maintain functional networks (LAN, WLAN, WAN).', '• Cisco Catalyst and Nexus switches', '• Cisco network routers', 'Participate and lead team project initiatives to update architecture, perform fleet upgrades, drive new data center builds & expansions, add new technology, etc.', 'Ability to work pre-scheduled alternate shifts to accommodate customer testing.', '• Alcatel OMNISWITCH switches', 'Develop, validate and maintain documentation.', 'Ensure security updates and software patches applied in a timely manner.', 'Close coordination with other internal teams (Cloud, Mainframe, Power Systems, Hosting, Test Management, etc.) in preparation of events.', 'Automate routine tasks and monitor effectiveness.', 'Define network delivery scope and development.', '• Palo Alto firewalls, Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS)', 'Customer Onboarding', 'Equipment procurement, setup and deployment based on customer contracted requirements.', 'Maintain close consultation with Sales team for Network solution.', 'Ability to present/explain network solution & process to technical and non-technical consumers.', '• Dell switches', 'Customer facing role in pre-sales discussions with potential customers.', 'Coordination with other internal teams (Cloud, Mainframe, Power Systems, Hosting, etc.) in solution development.', '• DWDM/Layer 1 equipment', 'Pre-sales/Sales Support for Network', 'Testing, troubleshooting and validating connectivity and solutions.', 'Conduct routine network capacity, performance and scaling analysis & planning.', 'In this role, you should have excellent problem-solving skills and thorough knowledge of network administration and architecture. If you’re also passionate about security and data protection, we’d like to meet you. Your goal will be to establish network solutions that cater to customer disaster recovery/business continuity needs.', 'Network Infrastructure', '• Load Balancers', 'Monitor, tune and optimize network performance and integrity.', 'The successful Senior Network Engineer will be responsible for providing network support services to both Recovery Point internally and its customers. The candidate will be representing Recovery Point and must be comfortable communicating directly with customers. The Senior Network Engineer will be responsible for:', 'Develop Visio network solution diagramming.', 'Familiarity with Tier 1 service providers, circuits, terminology.', 'Coordination with Customer Network team identifying detail requirements to establish connectivity to RPS facility (RPS provided Internet; customer provided dedicated P2P circuit, RPS provided dark fiber solution, etc.).', 'Conduct research and provide product solution identification, sizing and specifications based on customer requirements.', 'Create, oversee and test security measures.', 'Provide technical support during customer exercises.', 'Configure and troubleshoot security infrastructure devices.', 'Active participation in customer pre-test planning meetings.', 'Network Administration', 'Hands on experience in production security systems, including firewalls, intrusion detection systems, anti-virus software, authentication systems, log management, content filtering, etc.', 'Solid understanding of the latest security principles, techniques, and protocols.', 'Administration of a variety of network equipment including but not limited to', 'Participate in team on-call rotation.', 'Solid understanding of dark fiber transport and DWDM technology and equipment.', 'Extensive Layer 2 and Layer 3 knowledge & experience (including virtualized infrastructure).', 'Security Administration', 'Setup and teardown of network infrastructures for customer Disaster Recovery exercises.', 'Possess familiarity with industry replication and backup solutions, software and technologies as they pertain to Network.', 'Lead and supervise as directed by management.', 'Participate in customer onboarding meetings; cross-functional coordination with other internal teams.', '• Aruba wireless systems', '• Cisco ASA and Firepower firewalls, Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS)']

Ability to evaluate and plan migrations to Amazon Redshift.#CBIND123Employee Status : Full Time EmployeeShift : Day JobTravel : NoJob Posting : Dec 04 2020About CognizantCognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. and ensures application and system stability.', '4+ years of development experience with Java-Spring Boot, Node.JS express framework, dockers, EKS', 'Mentors less experienced developers on best practices in AWS Cloud technology.', 'Strong experience of test-driven development (TDD) and unit testing, leveraging automation toolsets', 'Implementation of data streaming from Legacy Systems(MVS DB2/VSAM) and Teradata to Cloud platform experience would be a plus.', 'Company', ' May serve in a Scrum Master role for an agile team', 'Job Specifications', 'Bachelors of Computer Science is preferred, or equivalent relevant business experience6+ years of experience in software development and delivery track record in a range or roles in a scrum environment2+ years of development experience with AWS Services implemented Cloud Data Solutions.4+ years of development experience with Java-Spring Boot, Node.JS express framework, dockers, EKSExperience with Docker and Kubernetes. ['', 'We are looking for a self-motivated EDW Engineer Manager to join our data engineering team to lead design, build, test and maintain architectures such as EDW, data lake and large -scale data processing systems. Lead a team of data engineers to build, monitor and support EDW ingestions, data marts and extracts to meet various SLAs for our broad data and analytic community. The ideal candidate also leads on-going operation performance and security activities to support EDW access and optimization of user queries. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing and/or redesigning our data landscape to support the next generation of products and data initiatives.', '• Designed systems that are highly reliable, self-recovering, and require little or no supporting manpower', '• 3 years Informatica, Talend data integration tool is a plus', 'We seek employees who bring passion, are highly collaborative, and thrive in a dynamic, diverse, and inclusive team. We work in a highly agile environment with a focus on quality and achieving real impact with our work. We are excited to have a team with a rich mix of experiences, with people who bring innovative approaches to their work, an excitement for looking at things from new angles, and a spirit of continuous improvement. Finally, we seek employees who embrace and live our core values of respect, recognition, communication, commitment, trust, innovation, and service. If this sounds like you, we invite you to apply.', '• Healthcare experience, most notably in Clinical data, Epic, Payer data and reference data is a plus', 'As a not-for-profit organization, Mass General Brigham is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Mass General Brigham supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.', '• Expert/advanced level of experience with ETL/ELT tools', 'About Us:', 'PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES', '\xa0', '• Has mentored and developed technical competency of junior team members', 'SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY', 'MGB has implemented special remote working policies due to COVID-19. These policies are subject to change; however, it is currently expected that this position will work remotely (e.g. from home) full time through June 2021', '• 3 plus years of experience with building larger data warehouse in SQL Server, SSIS', 'Team Description', '• Experience leading a team', '• Build and enhance standard solution that provides efficient and scalable ETL/ELT solutions from multiple data sources', 'Role Summary/Overview', 'EDW data engineering team supports various data source ingestion and builds analytics data layer in EDW. The team also manages ETL/ELT operation, performance and site -specific security for our broad data and analytics community.', 'We’re focused on a people-first culture for our system’s patients and our professional family. That’s why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. Mass General Brigham is committed to aligning our employees’ personal aspirations with projects that match their capabilities and creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team to own their personal development—and we recognize success at every step.', '• Support BI Developers, Data Architects, Data Analysts and Data Scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects', '• Ability to troubleshoot system bottleneck and conduct performance tuning in large data warehouse or data lake', 'WORKING CONDITIONS', '• 3 plus years of experience architecting and building data ingestions and data integration solution for Enterprise Data and Analytics Solutions', 'Description', '• Familiarity with data engineering, data governance and data quality principles', '• Experience with logical and physical data modeling', '• Experience with real time data processing and analytics products is a plus', 'GENERAL SUMMARY / OVERVIEW', 'The value of investments in data and analytics were proven out during our response to COVID-19 as these investments were leveraged to stand up new reporting and analytic capabilities to support executive and clinical leadership on managing the pandemic. Our broad data and analytic community has come together across Mass General Brigham ’s 14 healthcare sites with shared urgency, delivering analytic tools to our system that drove timely insights in both clinical and operational domains, resulting in effective delivery of critical care and in organizational efficiencies during a time of reduced resources.', 'Mass General Brigham’s board and system-wide executive leadership are making significant investments in enterprise data and digital health, enabling innovation and transformation in the delivery of health care, research and discovery. By building out core digital and data capabilities, we are supporting the achievement of Mass General Brigham’s mission to drive growth and innovation in inpatient, ambulatory, and digital care. We are at the start of this journey and we are looking for talented individuals from across the nation to join us in transforming healthcare and in achieving the expected outcomes of this strategy: improved patient care, quality of care, patient engagement, and efficiency in the delivery of healthcare with excellence.', '• Experience with change control, release management and other ITIL processes', '• Will manage team of 5-6 Data Engineers', '• Strong SQL skills and workload management on multi-processing data platform (preferred MPP systems)', 'Overview', 'Our employees use the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.', '• Lead a group of 5-6 data engineers to ensure data loads meet SLA and manage proper data availability communication', '• Participate in building out existing EDW in SQL Server and new Data Lake, expanding and optimizing the data ecosystem, as well as optimizing data engineering processes', 'In the achievement of these goals, Mass General Brigham’s data and analytic teams are working together to build a system-wide data ecosystem. We are both leveraging current assets and building new, integrated solutions to provide a holistic set of industry-leading data and analytic capabilities, supporting Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and real-time insights. Teams from Data and Analytics, Research Analytics, Clinical Data Science, and Information Systems are collaborating to build this new data and analytic ecosystem. To ensure success of this effort, Mass General Brigham is standing up a new Data and Analytics operating model with a goal of driving a level of standardization for data and analytic operations across the teams involved.', 'Mass General Brigham’s main office is in Somerville, MA. We are currently working as a fully-remote team due to COVID-19 and encourage applications from across the US as telecommuting becomes part of our new normal. We are committed to building an engaged, inclusive community and offer a variety of opportunities to come together virtually and facilitate learning and collaboration.', 'PREFERRED SKILLS/ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES', '• Oversee EDW ingestions and integrations to ensure SLAs are met in all EDW environments', '• Use/s the Mass General Brigham values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration', '• Collabrate and lead ETL/DB solution, code and pre-prod review to ensure data build and delivery architecture is efficient and consistent throughout ongoing projects', '• Ensure the quality of data assets and robustness of data engineering processes', '• Health Catalyst knowledge is a plus', '• Experience leading development and support of Enterprise Data Warehouse or Data Lake Architectures', 'As a not-for-profit organization, Mass General Brigham is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to our community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Mass General Brigham supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.']

['', 'Knowledge Transfer ', '• Provide on-site assistance for knowledge transfer with operations personnel • Train customers on how to access support, knowledge base, and other available complimentary/paid services. Adopting the Security Operating Platform is not just a transition but a transformation to a prevention-based architecture. The Resident Engineer Program is one piece of the comprehensive portfolio of services we offer to assist with this transformation, from design and architecture to implementation and operations. Recognized for exceptional customer service, our certified support, education, and professional services are available to maximize the protection and value of your investment.', 'Engineer Responsibilities ', 'Transformation expertise from the initial deployment or migration to advanced feature implementation helps you reduce risk, employ current industry best practices, and improve operational efficiency.', 'Location: Deerfield Beach, FL', 'End-to-end planning for Palo Alto Networks Security Operating Platform, including network, data center, endpoint, and cloud, ensures the ideal deployment for your needs.', 'Migrate ', 'Resident Engineer ', '\ufeff', '• Facilitate development of new application and threat signatures • Assist customers with managing Palo Alto Networks product licenses', 'Duration: 12 Months', 'Palo Alto Networks recognizes that you need the right people for successful deployment and operation of security technologies. However, recruiting and retaining staff with the right skills in your geography can be time-consuming and may not be the right option for your company. This is why we offer our Resident Engineer Program, which provides a product expert to aid in the implementation and operation of your Palo Alto Networks next-generation firewalls (NGFWs) as well as endpoint and cloud products. Extend Your Team As a member of your security team, a resident engineer is uniquely qualified to advise your team on the right configuration for your organization. Combining product expertise and a clear understanding of your goals, a resident engineer can help match your requirements with product capabilities. Security and Product Expertise All resident engineers have professional backgrounds in security with domain expertise in deployment and operation. Under our program, they undergo extensive product training and earn certification on the Security Operating Platform. In addition, as the go-to people for all issues related to our products, our resident engineers maintain close ties to our Product Management and the top tiers of our Support teams to help them solve complex issues that can arise in protecting your corporate assets.', 'A security and product expert assists with ongoing deployment, maintenance, and operations.', '• Plan migration tasks • Analyze existing rules and objects • Optimize and migrate policies and objects from existing environment to Palo Alto Networks NGFW • Test and validate migration environment • Coordinate and execute cutover to production', 'Position: Palo Alto Network Engineer', 'classroom training, using a combination of lecture, demonstration, and hands-on labs, ensures an efficient transfer of critical product knowledge to your staff.', 'Maintain ', 'Architecture and Design ', 'Consulting Services ', 'Education Professional ', 'Troubleshoot ', 'Assist Palo Alto Networks Support team to troubleshoot product issues']

job_title: Big Data Engineer - Automated Deployment Infrastructure
job_text: ['', 'Leverage DevOps tool stack to build, inspect, deploy, test and promote new or updated features.', 'May serve as technical lead, architect, project lead or principle developer in course of large or complex project.', 'Expert proficiency in advanced behavior-driven testing techniques.', 'Create or Update documentation in support of development efforts. Documents may include detailed specifications, implementation guides, architecture diagrams or design documents.', 'Provide expertise for teams in all matters related to deployment, building and release process.', 'Expert proficiency in Object Oriented Design (OOD) and analysis.', 'Support the team in the writing of deployment scripts and place strong emphasis in automated deployment, infrastructure automation solutions, and continuous delivery process.', 'Serve as a technical lead for an Agile team and actively participate in all Agile ceremonies.', 'Work with product owners and other development team members to determine new features and user stories needed in large/complex development projects', 'Respond to trouble/support calls for applications in production in order to make quick repair to keep application in production.', 'Expert proficiency in application of non-functional software qualities such as resiliency, maintainability, etc.', ' Support the team in the writing of deployment scripts and place strong emphasis in automated deployment, infrastructure automation solutions, and continuous delivery process. Work with product owners and other development team members to determine new features and user stories needed in large/complex development projects Create or Update documentation in support of development efforts. Documents may include detailed specifications, implementation guides, architecture diagrams or design documents. Participate in code reviews with peers and managers to ensure that each increment adheres to original vision as described in the user story and all standard resource libraries and architecture patterns as appropriate. Respond to trouble/support calls for applications in production in order to make quick repair to keep application in production. Serve as a technical lead for an Agile team and actively participate in all Agile ceremonies. Participate in all team ceremonies including planning, grooming, product demonstration and team retrospectives Mentor or provide technical guidance to less experienced staff; may use high end development tools to assist or facilitate development process. Leverage DevOps tool stack to build, inspect, deploy, test and promote new or updated features. May serve as technical lead, architect, project lead or principle developer in course of large or complex project. Expert proficiency in unit testing as well as coding in 1-2 languages (eg Java, etc). Expert proficiency in Object Oriented Design (OOD) and analysis. Expert proficiency in application of analysis/design engineering functions. Expert proficiency in application of non-functional software qualities such as resiliency, maintainability, etc. Expert proficiency in advanced behavior-driven testing techniques. Provide expertise for teams in all matters related to deployment, building and release process.', 'Mentor or provide technical guidance to less experienced staff; may use high end development tools to assist or facilitate development process.', 'Participate in all team ceremonies including planning, grooming, product demonstration and team retrospectives', 'Expert proficiency in application of analysis/design engineering functions.', 'Participate in code reviews with peers and managers to ensure that each increment adheres to original vision as described in the user story and all standard resource libraries and architecture patterns as appropriate.', 'Expert proficiency in unit testing as well as coding in 1-2 languages (eg Java, etc).']

['Bring in strong perspective and collaborative partnership environment that leads change and motivates engineers to design systems for today, but enable the flexibility, robustness in the system so that it can survive in an ever-changing environment.', 'Experience with Terraform, Splunk, monitoring and alerting systems', 'Experience with AWS (Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB, S3, IAM)', 'Lead the craftsmanship, availability, resilience, and scalability of your solutions', 'Implement practices that supports rapid development of platform without compromising the quality.', 'Familiar with Selenium framework', 'Experience in Event-driven messaging design and implementationExpert level knowledge in Node.jsExperience with modern web UI frameworks (i.e. React).Experience with AWS (Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB, S3, IAM)Experience with Git, Atlassian stackExperience with Terraform, Splunk, monitoring and alerting systemsExperience with Okta, OAuth and other authentication schemesFamiliar with API testing frameworkFamiliar with Selenium frameworkExperience with OpenAPI SpecExperience with OAuth 2.0 flowsExperience in agile developmentExperience in working with DevOps and container developmentExperience with Apigee is a plusMarketplace experience is a plus', 'Qualifications', 'Fortellis is growing and expanding. We are looking for a senior or principle level platform engineer. This person will be part of the Fortellis platform team to work in a fast-paced environment and to build the platform to change the industry. This is a hands-on, results oriented position with innovation and execution mindset. ', 'This position is based on Austin, TX, or San Jose, CA', 'Ability to contribute to multiple projects/demands simultaneously.', 'At CDK, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives they provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.', 'Power the PossibilitiesThe CDK Global technology team is looking for collaborative innovators who are passionate about making their mark on emerging enterprise software products. We’re building and developing cloud technology for the automotive retail industrythat will change the landscape for automotive dealers, original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and the customers they serve.Be Part of Something BiggerEach year, more than three percent of the U.S. gross domestic product (GDP) is attributed to the auto industry, which flows through our customer, the auto dealer. It’s time you joined an evolving marketplace where research and developmentinvestment is measured in the tens of billions. It’s time you were a part of something bigger.We’re expanding our workforce – engineers, architects, developers and more – onboarding early adopters who can optimize, pivot and keep pace with ever-evolving development roadmaps and applications.Join Our TeamGrowth potential, flexibility and material impact on the success and quality of a next-gen, enterprise software product make CDK an excellent choice for those who thrive in challenging, fast-paced engineering environments.The possibilities for impact are endless. We have exceptional opportunities to evolve our industry by driving change through new technology.', 'Expert level knowledge in Node.js', 'Marketplace experience is a plus', 'Ability to grasp and assimilate unfamiliar technologies quickly and be comfortable implementing them.', 'Should be hands on development and capable of coaching other engineers on the team.', 'Work in an Agile environment with CI and CD process', 'Tech Stack Requirements', '5+ years of experience as a Senior or Principle Engineer, 3+ years of experience in working in AWS or similar cloud environments.', 'Familiar with API testing framework', 'Experience in REST API development, asynchronized messaging development ', 'Experience in agile development', 'Experience with Git, Atlassian stack', 'Experience in Event-driven messaging design and implementation', 'Have the ability to thrive in a high-pressured but highly customer-oriented environment.', 'Experience with Okta, OAuth and other authentication schemes', 'Have the ability to pass on the knowledge and design to team members in a way they are able to understand it so they can complete the work efficiently.', 'Experience with OpenAPI Spec', 'Experience with OAuth 2.0 flows', "Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent", 'Experience with Apigee is a plus', 'Power the Possibilities', 'Drive the platform design/implementation by working in close collaboration with the appropriate software development leadership, EA, Product and Business.', 'Key responsibilities', 'Possess the technical experience and hands-on technical skills to partner with team members and be comfortable diving into the fray as needed.', 'Drive the platform design/implementation by working in close collaboration with the appropriate software development leadership, EA, Product and Business.Bring in strong perspective and collaborative partnership environment that leads change and motivates engineers to design systems for today, but enable the flexibility, robustness in the system so that it can survive in an ever-changing environment.Balance the need for rapid change, rigor around systems and architectural concerns.Implement practices that supports rapid development of platform without compromising the quality.Ensure delivery of the requirements on time with quality.Should be hands on development and capable of coaching other engineers on the team.', 'CDK Global knows you have passions outside of work.  You have family, friends, sporting events, and lots of things going on.   That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to not only take care of you but your family as well.   All of our benefits are effective the first day of employment including 401K matching, paid time off to re-energize, donate your time to volunteer in your community, and tuition reimbursement to name a few.', 'If you’re ready for high-impact, you’re ready for CDK.', "Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent5+ years of experience as a Senior or Principle Engineer, 3+ years of experience in working in AWS or similar cloud environments.Experience in REST API development, asynchronized messaging development Possess the technical experience and hands-on technical skills to partner with team members and be comfortable diving into the fray as needed.Have the ability to pass on the knowledge and design to team members in a way they are able to understand it so they can complete the work efficiently.Have the ability to work in a dynamic and hyper growth work environment.Be capable of leading a discussion with upper management.Have the ability to thrive in a high-pressured but highly customer-oriented environment.Ability to contribute to multiple projects/demands simultaneously.Ability to grasp and assimilate unfamiliar technologies quickly and be comfortable implementing them.Work in an Agile environment with CI and CD processLead the craftsmanship, availability, resilience, and scalability of your solutions", 'Balance the need for rapid change, rigor around systems and architectural concerns.', 'Have the ability to work in a dynamic and hyper growth work environment.', 'Ensure delivery of the requirements on time with quality.', 'This is a great time to join CDK Global with highly motivated teams to build industry changing platform for the automotive industry. Fortellis Automotive Commerce Exchange™ platform, a technology engine that enables seamless connections and greater collaboration to occur among everyone involved in serving automobile consumers, such as dealers, manufacturers, software developers, lenders and data providers.', 'Experience in working with DevOps and container development', 'Be Part of Something Bigger', 'Join Our Team', 'Experience with modern web UI frameworks (i.e. React).', 'Be capable of leading a discussion with upper management.']

['', 'Applies computer science, engineering, and mathematical analysis concepts and principles in the development of software for the target application.', 'Must have an active Secret clearance.', 'Qualifications', 'Job Description', 'Essential Functions', 'Must have an active Secret clearance.Responsible for research, design, and development of computer software systems, in conjunction with hardware product development.Primarily responsible for the design and development of software products for a variety software applications.Participates in all phases of the software development life cycle, including requirements analysis, design, implementation, integration, and test of software products.Applies computer science, engineering, and mathematical analysis concepts and principles in the development of software for the target application.Works closely with cross functional members of the engineering organization to develop and evaluate interfaces between hardware and software, and operational performance requirements and design of the overall system. Develops software test procedures, software programs, and related documentation.Contributes to determining, estimating, and validating the cost and scope of software efforts to ensure software performed meets program cost, schedule, and technical constraints.Other duties as described.40% travel.', 'Works closely with cross functional members of the engineering organization to develop and evaluate interfaces between hardware and software, and operational performance requirements and design of the overall system. Develops software test procedures, software programs, and related documentation.', 'Description', 'Date posted', 'Job ID', '40% travel.', 'May have in-depth knowledge of project management.', 'Contributes to determining, estimating, and validating the cost and scope of software efforts to ensure software performed meets program cost, schedule, and technical constraints.', 'Bachelor’s Degree and minimum 9 years of prior relevant experience OR Graduate Degree and a minimum of 7 years of prior related experience.', 'Participates in all phases of the software development life cycle, including requirements analysis, design, implementation, integration, and test of software products.', 'Responsible for research, design, and development of computer software systems, in conjunction with hardware product development.', 'Other duties as described.', 'Due to growth, we are hiring in one of several locations: Goleta, CA, Salt Lake City, UT, OR Millersville, MD. This position could also be located close to an L3Harris office with 25-40% travel to Goleta, CA, Salt Lake City, UT OR Millersville, MD.Job DescriptionSubject matter expert with comprehensive knowledge of job area and in-depth knowledge of project management. Manages large, complex project initiatives of substantial importance to the organization with minimal oversight or direction. Communicates within and outside of the organization to explain and influence changes to practices, processes and approaches. Makes significant improvements in processes, systems, or products. Provides input into new products/processes and implements operational plans that have measurable impact on business or functional results.Essential FunctionsMust have an active Secret clearance.Responsible for research, design, and development of computer software systems, in conjunction with hardware product development.Primarily responsible for the design and development of software products for a variety software applications.Participates in all phases of the software development life cycle, including requirements analysis, design, implementation, integration, and test of software products.Applies computer science, engineering, and mathematical analysis concepts and principles in the development of software for the target application.Works closely with cross functional members of the engineering organization to develop and evaluate interfaces between hardware and software, and operational performance requirements and design of the overall system. Develops software test procedures, software programs, and related documentation.Contributes to determining, estimating, and validating the cost and scope of software efforts to ensure software performed meets program cost, schedule, and technical constraints.Other duties as described.40% travel.QualificationsRequires comprehensive level knowledge of job area typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience.May have in-depth knowledge of project management.Bachelor’s Degree and minimum 9 years of prior relevant experience OR Graduate Degree and a minimum of 7 years of prior related experience.Please be aware many of our positions require the ability to obtain a security clearance. Security clearances may only be granted to U.S. citizens. In addition, applicants who accept a conditional offer of employment may be subject to government security investigation(s) and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.By submitting your résumé for this position, you understand and agree that L3Harris Technologies may share your résumé, as well as any other related personal information or documentation you provide, with its subsidiaries and affiliated companies for the purpose of considering you for other available positions.L3Harris Technologies is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. L3Harris is committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity and maintaining a workplace that is free from unlawful discrimination. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding or other related medical conditions), gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, characteristic or membership in any other group protected by federal, state or local laws. L3Harris maintains a drug-free workplace and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing and background checks, where permitted by law.', 'Requires comprehensive level knowledge of job area typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience.May have in-depth knowledge of project management.Bachelor’s Degree and minimum 9 years of prior relevant experience OR Graduate Degree and a minimum of 7 years of prior related experience.', 'Primarily responsible for the design and development of software products for a variety software applications.', 'Requires comprehensive level knowledge of job area typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience.']

job_title: Senior Software Engineer, Camera or Cloud Systems
job_text: ['', 'Help plan and and execute our migration of existing services to microservices (Docker, Kubernetes)', 'Understand that privacy is inherently valuable for everyone, and work to make sure our system is transparent in its operation and secure with its data', ' Help plan and and execute our migration of existing services to microservices (Docker, Kubernetes) Design, code, package, and deploy core applications, with a focus on security (Go, Python, Scala, Java, Ruby, etc.) Create and prioritize useful and actionable metrics, monitoring, and alerting (Statsd, Grafana, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Pagerduty) Continuously improve resilience and performance of services via chaos engineering or other means Lead, mentor, and spread best practices to other engineers on the team Contribute to documentation to clearly define out workflows and service architectures Create unit, functional, and integration tests for services to ensure quality and correctness ', 'Lead, mentor, and spread best practices to other engineers on the team', 'Create unit, functional, and integration tests for services to ensure quality and correctness', 'Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.', 'Continuously improve resilience and performance of services via chaos engineering or other means', ' Have 2+ years of production experience with containers and container orchestration such as Docker and Kubernetes Have 4+ years of production experience with one of these or similar languages: Go/Python/Scala/Java/Ruby Successfully developed distributed systems at scale (a plus if IoT) in the past Would be excited to join a people-focused team, and look forward to contributing time to help your teammates Are familiar with Linux at an advanced level and can debug performance of a web service Take a focused, organized approach to development, testing, and quality Understand that privacy is inherently valuable for everyone, and work to make sure our system is transparent in its operation and secure with its data A plus: have experience with Audio/Video codecs (H264, etc.) and streaming protocols like HLS, RTSP, DASH ', 'Take a focused, organized approach to development, testing, and quality', 'Have 2+ years of production experience with containers and container orchestration such as Docker and Kubernetes', 'You Are An Ideal Fit If You', 'Who You’ll Work With', 'Contribute to documentation to clearly define out workflows and service architectures', 'Have 4+ years of production experience with one of these or similar languages: Go/Python/Scala/Java/Ruby', 'Would be excited to join a people-focused team, and look forward to contributing time to help your teammates', "What You'll Work On", 'Who We Are', 'Create and prioritize useful and actionable metrics, monitoring, and alerting (Statsd, Grafana, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Pagerduty)', 'At Cisco Meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.', 'Successfully developed distributed systems at scale (a plus if IoT) in the past', 'Design, code, package, and deploy core applications, with a focus on security (Go, Python, Scala, Java, Ruby, etc.)', 'A plus: have experience with Audio/Video codecs (H264, etc.) and streaming protocols like HLS, RTSP, DASH', 'Are familiar with Linux at an advanced level and can debug performance of a web service']

job_title: Entry Level Factory Automation Service Engineer
job_text: ['', " AA/BA in Engineering  3-year vocational training  3 to 5 years of hands on proficiency with Automation Controls, PLC's, and low voltage drives. Candidate should be able to read and understand electrical plans, specifications, drawings, and installation schematics.  Knowledge and ability to use electrical measurement equipment including multimeters, meggers, and oscilloscopes.  Individual must possess a valid Driver’s license in good standing Willingness to work a flexible schedule (nights and weekends, as needed) 20% Travel possible ", 'The field service engineer will be embedded in the customer manufacturing facility and will work an 8-hour day between 7am to 5 pm. In addition, overtime may be required for emergency job/call outs /or for scheduled or planned shutdown activities. Some weekend and after regular hours will be required. ', 'AA/BA in Engineering ', 'Experience with Siemens Simatic PLCs and HMIs (Siemens Step 7, TIA Portal, WinCC) and Siemens Sinamics VFDs is preferred.', 'Company:', 'Additional training will be provided for automotive customer’s core software standards of program structure, blocks & calls, data, sequencers, etc.', 'Candidate should display a high level of critical thinking in bringing successful resolution to high-impact, complex, and/or cross-functional problems.', ' Attend and complete Siemens annual safety training and execute all activities in a safe manner while following all customer site and Siemens safety guidelines and policies. Site support for Siemens Factory Automation and to support customer in the use of Siemens hardware, software, engineering, commissioning, product support and service needs.', "3 to 5 years of hands on proficiency with Automation Controls, PLC's, and low voltage drives.", ' Experience with Siemens Simatic PLCs and HMIs (Siemens Step 7, TIA Portal, WinCC) and Siemens Sinamics VFDs is preferred. Electrical, automation or control is preferred Experience in automotive industry assembly systems is preferred. German language skills are a plus Programming Personal Safety equipment (i.e. Sick PLS) is a plus. MS-Office Applications: Excel, Word, MS-Project ', 'Experience in automotive industry assembly systems is preferred.', 'Organization:', 'Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination Provision', 'Position will be based in the Austin, TX area, exclusively.', 'Provide on-site technical and operational support when required.', '20% Travel possible', 'California Privacy Notice', 'Position will require effective communications skills, both internal and external. Candidate will be interfacing with customer contacts at different levels/functions within their organization, essentially the customer’s onsite face of Siemens.', 'Active support role in the creation of new automated systems and upgrades as well as the optimizing of existing systems. ', 'The entry level factory automation service engineer position will provide Siemens support to a global automotive manufacturing company that utilizes Siemens Factory Automation products in various manufacturing processes and material handling systems. ', 'Experience Level:', 'EEO is the Law', "Qualified applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Qualified applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States.  AA/BA in Engineering  3-year vocational training  3 to 5 years of hands on proficiency with Automation Controls, PLC's, and low voltage drives. Candidate should be able to read and understand electrical plans, specifications, drawings, and installation schematics.  Knowledge and ability to use electrical measurement equipment including multimeters, meggers, and oscilloscopes. Shall possess and demonstrate knowledge of a wide range of multidisciplinary professional engineering concepts, principles, practices, standards, methods, techniques, materials, and equipment to effectively apply advanced engineering theories, principles, and concepts to project development, execution, and advisory services. Shall provide advisory assistance in developing system concepts, and in performing technological/trade-off study assessments of proposed designs. Shall assist with providing technical support in planning, analyzing, and evaluating efforts used to define total weapons systems/subsystem requirements, translate requirements into design criteria, evaluate alternative design approaches, develop system specifications, and perform technological/trade-off study assessments of proposed designs to include airworthiness (and tailored airworthiness criteria). Shall provide support in developing system performance requirements, objectives and integration, and the estimation of time and resources for system design, development, and support. Shall apply expertise in the field of engineering and extensive knowledge of the assigned functional area to assist in resolving unique or novel problems related to design and development engineering including having knowledge of: the principles of planning and program management; standard acquisition regulations, practices, and procedures; and other engineering disciplines used in support of sustainment, modification, and maintenance programs. Shall assist with planning, analyzing, and evaluating engineering and technical efforts used to define total weapons system/subsystem requirements, translating requirements into design criteria, evaluating alternative design approaches, and developing the system specifications. Shall perform analysis and assist with evaluating proposals, presenting conclusions/recommendations, and integrating technical requirements, directives, and program plans in support of assigned projects/programs in systems engineering, including the preparation and review of detailed specifications, drawings, and supporting documents. Additionally, shall assist with evaluating performance with respect to program requirements, evaluating design changes to assess effects on performance, and recommending changes to reduce system cost. Shall assist with coordinating special studies on design changes, recommending solutions to technical problems, and recommending different engineering approaches through the development phase and into production. Additionally, shall assist with managing performance/cost relationships and analyzing systems/equipment to ensure functional/operational integrity and reliability. Shall assist in performing complex and comprehensive analyses and use systematic, disciplined, quantifiable approaches to determine performance objectives and integration issues. Shall assist with: Developing, implementing, and documenting projects; Ascertaining needed changes or modifications to production methods, procedures, and/or approaches; Documenting systems requirements; Evaluating procedures and employing innovative techniques and methods to achieve goals; Supporting engineering reviews and/or panels, developing evaluations and technical justifications of feasibility, practicability, and technical soundness, recognizing priorities as well as the urgency of the situation; work may include use or development of computer-aided engineering and analysis tools; Developing, executing, and reviewing policies, processes, and procedures of a special or miscellaneous character that may span multiple engineering disciplines and requires application of knowledge of such fundamentals; Participating in special projects/initiatives, and preparing oral/written reports; Presenting briefings and developing technical reports to document progress and results; Preparing management reports and conducting technical presentations for planning, implementation, and corrective action; Performing airworthiness determinations, Military Flight Release (MFR) preparation, Modification Airworthiness Certification Criteria (MACC) development, and reportability determinations per the latest version of Military Handbook (MIL-HDBK) 516.   Shall assist in conducting limited modeling, simulation, and analysis of the effects of individual modifications on the survivability/vulnerability of the SOF platforms. Shall communicate potential risks, issues, and recommendations to the Government for consideration. Shall assist the Government by providing guidance on the technical direction and policy for development and integration of propulsion systems: performance and operability, structures and subsystems, and controls. Shall provide advisory assistance and draft documentation support for the development, deployment, and maintenance technical requirements associated with propulsion system development and sustainment. Shall assist in providing systems and subsystems engineering, technical guidance, and support to design, develop, manufacture, integrate, test, and deploy electronic sensors, aircraft signature reduction technology, and defensive avionics for airborne weapon systems to ensure total weapon system compatibility with the electromagnetic environment and to ensure aircraft survivability. Shall provide advisory assistance and draft documentation support for translating DoD user requirements into system requirements for Government consideration. Shall provide advisory assistance and draft documentation support by performing technical/mission analyses of operational requirements. Shall assist in reviewing the overall system design baseline, including but not limited to architecture and interoperability requirements. Shall communicate potential risks, issues, and recommendations to the Government for consideration. Shall assist in the review of specifications including, but not limited to, system, system segment, equipment, and Interface Control Documents (ICDs), that are submitted by the weapon system contractor or other DoD agencies involved in the program. Shall provide advisory assistance and draft documentation (to include DoD Architecture Framework Products and Information Support Plans) by conducting systems analyses to include, but not limited to, system design/design feasibility, state-of-the-art assessments in support of the program, technical, and Milestone reviews. Shall provide advisory support by reviewing user requirements and priorities for SOF programs and provide cost/benefit assessments of user requirements to support CDD and CPD scope. Shall provide advisory assistance in the review of available data on all the on-going and planned modification projects. Shall assist in performing analysis designed to ensure Operational Safety, Suitability, and Effectiveness (OSS&E) of all supported weapons systems. Shall communicate potential risks, issues, and recommendations to the Government for consideration. Shall provide advisory assistance and draft documentation support by evaluating program technical risk and OSS&E, establishing risk mitigation plans, and overseeing program technical risk reduction efforts. Shall support and participate in TIMs, design reviews, configuration review boards, computer resources working groups, interoperability working groups, and interface control working groups program reviews. Shall provide advisory assistance and draft documentation support for developing summary information on the activities, action items, conclusions, and recommendations related to meetings and reviews. Shall provide advisory assistance and draft documentation support for the preparation of briefings. Documentation support shall include compiling and organizing background information, preparing draft briefings and talking papers, and providing backup documentation as required. Shall assist in facilitating briefings, as required. Shall provide advisory assistance and draft documentation in support of weapon system contractor source selections, to include the development of the Acquisition Strategy Plans (ASPs), Instructions to Offerors (ITOs), and technical evaluation criteria. Shall assist with developing and documenting recommended engineering inputs for PWSs, RFPs, and CDRLs for assigned programs. Shall support the Government in developing and maintaining requirements using tools such as the Dynamic Object-Oriented Requirements System (DOORS) and a baseline architecture model using tools such as IBM Rational System Architect (RSA), and shall assist in developing courses of action and architecture products to support decision making. Shall provide data links and networking interoperability engineering, consultation, and support to design, develop, manufacture, integrate, test, and deploy subsystems components for air-to-air and air-to-ground communications. Support shall extend to design, development, integration, and testing of data link messaging such as J-Series, K-Series, and VMF messages in accordance with MIL-STDs -6016 and -6017. Additionally, such support shall also include the development and sustainment of Network Architectures as well as the processes required to obtain Air Force Systems Interoperability Testing (AFSIT) and Joint Interoperability Test Command (JITC) certifications. Shall provide advisory assistance and draft documentation support to conduct reviews and studies, document performance requirements, and support modifications affecting the flight mechanics and for system-level integration. Shall assist the Government by providing knowledge and guidance and producing artifacts to support systems integration; OSS&E; airworthiness certification per the latest version of MIL-HDBK-516; safety per MIL-STD-882; and AFI 63-1201 Life Cycle Systems Engineering.
